title: (x) Type ID - Commerzbank / stressed sans for old logo - custom, similar to Optima Bold {Florian}
content:
Hello,  
Could someone help my with this one?

Thanks in advance!  
C

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Commerzbank.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141116092733/http:/typophile.com/files/Commerzbank_0.jpg) | 73.26 KB |
author: CandyP

comments.content:
Hi Candy,  
there’s no image.  
Need help? [How to post a sample or image](http://web.archive.org/web/20141116092733/http:/typophile.com/node/18067)  
In particular, make sure that:

- the file name does not contain spaces (or any other ø∂∂ ¢håræct€rs)
- you have the right [Flash plugin](http://web.archive.org/web/20141116092733/http:/www.adobe.com/products/flashplayer/) installed with your browser

The Commerzbank logo used to feature a custom bold stressed sans, similar to Optima. The recent redesign brought a more contemporary logotype by [Luc(as) de Groot](http://web.archive.org/web/20141116092733/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Luc%28as%29%20de%20Groot), see the [article on Fontblog](http://web.archive.org/web/20141116092733/http:/www.fontblog.de/das-neue-commerzbank-logo).  
Apart from the logo, there’s a corporate typeface based on Linotype’s Compatil, [Commerzbank Compatil](http://web.archive.org/web/20141116092733/http:/www.linotype.com/en/24-19724/corporatetypedownload.html). Before that, there was a bold oblique slab called Commerzbank Head. More info in [this article in DMIG 2](http://web.archive.org/web/20141116092733/http:/www.designmadeingermany.de/magazin/2/corporate-design-commerzbank/dmig2_commerzbank.pdf) [PDF, 0.85 MB].  
F

Wow Florian! Thanks for all that info. I really appreciate it.

I thought I uploaded the image but something went wrong apparently. It's there now.

Again, thanks!  
C
